content.description: Start with a fun slabby side pull, friction your way up with a few slopers at the top. Great views! Sun is at your back around 5-6pm.
content.location: Take Granite Dells Road until you find the East side parking area. Park here. This parking area is about 100 yards before the locked gate that crosses the road. Go past the gate until you see the river ravine on the right side of the trail. Cross down the ravine via steep foot/deer path on the right and up the main draw to Boulders Loop Trail. Take the right fork on the trail about 5-10 yards and Good Friday is about 10-15 yards into the tree lineGrid Coordinate:(34.2272200, -111.2625640)https://www.google.com/maps/place/34%C2%B013'38.0%22N+111%C2%B015'45.2%22W/@34.2271605,-111.2626035,218m/data=!3m1!1e3!4m5!3m4!1s0x0:0x0!8m2!3d34.22722!4d-111.262564

content.description: Fun short problem! The top out is the cruxy part, awkward slanted walk-off.
content.location: Crooked Lip is on the south side of the ravine, about 30m south west of the of the foot trail draw.Coordinates:34.22732597572076, -111.2625371442868

content.description: Cool riverbed/ravine area near the Boulders Loop Trail Head
